RelatedSentence: ( WMOT )   --   WMOT is again this year asking news makers from across the political spectrum to comment on the just concluded 108th Tennessee General Assembly .
Becker says the year 's biggest legislative disappointment was the state 's failure to accept the federal expansion of Medicaid .
Becker says failing to accept the federal money is costing Tennessee billions of dollars a year , dollars that could have been spent on care for the state 's poorest residents .

Under the deal , Tennessee hospitals put up $ 450 million so that the State of Tennessee can qualify to receive $ 1.2 billion in federal Medicaid funding .

Becker says the assessment pact will forestall in the coming year what he calls dramatic , devastating cuts to TennCare , Tennessee 's version of Medicaid .
